metadata.feature_description: Integrates with DNN scheduler for automated crawling tasks.

steps.action: Navigate to Settings > Scheduler in Persona Bar
steps.expected: Scheduler page loads with list of scheduled tasks
steps.actual: Scheduler page loaded successfully showing all scheduled tasks including Search crawlers

steps.action: Click Edit button for Search: Url Crawler task
steps.expected: Edit form opens showing URL crawler configuration
steps.actual: Edit form opened showing Full Class Name: DotNetNuke.Professional.SearchCrawler.SearchSpider.SearchSpider, Frequency: 1 Day, Retry Time Lapse: 30 Minutes, Enable Schedule toggle visible

steps.action: Click Edit button for Search: File Crawler task
steps.expected: Edit form opens showing File crawler configuration
steps.actual: Edit form opened showing Full Class Name: DotNetNuke.Professional.SearchCrawler.FileCrawler.FileCrawler, Frequency: 1 Day, Retry Time Lapse: 30 Minutes, Object Dependencies: SearchCrawler, Enable Schedule toggle visible

steps.action: Open Search: File Crawler edit form and change Frequency from 1 to 2 Days
steps.expected: Frequency value changes and Update button becomes enabled
steps.actual: Frequency field successfully changed to 2, Update button became enabled indicating the form detected the change

steps.action: Click Cancel button to discard changes
steps.expected: Cancel confirmation appears or form closes without saving
steps.actual: Form closed successfully, changes discarded, original frequency value preserved

steps.action: Open Search: File Crawler edit form and locate Enable Schedule toggle
steps.expected: Enable Schedule toggle is visible with On/Off state
steps.actual: Enable Schedule toggle is visible showing 'On' state with a blue toggle switch. The toggle controls whether the scheduled task runs automatically.

steps.action: Verify enabled tasks show checkmark in ENABLED column
steps.expected: Enabled tasks display checkmark icon in the list
steps.actual: All three search crawlers (Search: File Crawler, Search: Site Crawler, Search: Url Crawler) show checkmark icons in the ENABLED column indicating they are active

steps.action: Click on HISTORY tab in Scheduler page
steps.expected: Schedule history displays with execution logs
steps.actual: HISTORY tab displayed 735 schedule history records showing execution details including: Description, Ran On Server, Duration (Secs), Succeeded status, Start/End times

steps.action: Verify Search: Site Crawler execution logs
steps.expected: Crawler execution history shows detailed logs
steps.actual: Search: Site Crawler execution logs visible showing: Starting message, Content change start time, Deleted Objects count, Tabs Indexed, Modules (Metadata/Content) Indexed, Users indexed, Total Items Indexed, 'Indexing Successful' status. Duration: 0.096 secs. Checkmark indicates successful execution.

steps.action: Open scheduler edit form and locate Run Now button
steps.expected: Run Now button is available to manually trigger task execution
steps.actual: Run Now button is visible and enabled in the edit form alongside Delete, Cancel, and Update buttons. This allows administrators to manually trigger crawler execution on demand.

observations: The scheduler integration includes three search-related scheduled tasks: Search: File Crawler, Search: Site Crawler, and Search: Url Crawler
Search: Site Crawler runs every 1 minute while Search: File Crawler and Search: Url Crawler run every 1 day
The schedule history shows 735 execution records indicating active scheduler operation
Code review confirms SearchSpider.cs extends SchedulerClient and implements DoWork() for URL crawling, while FileCrawler.cs implements file directory indexing
Both crawlers use ScheduleHistoryItem.AddLogNote() for progress reporting which is visible in the HISTORY tab
The scheduler supports configuration of: Frequency, Retry Time Lapse, Schedule Start Date/Time, Run on Event, Catch Up Tasks, and Enable Schedule toggle
